node.title: 'Heroic' taxi driver praised for actions after Liverpool hospital terror blast
node.alt: A car on fire in the carpark of a hospital in Liverpool.
node.description: Police say the passenger in the vehicle, who was killed in the blast, brought an explosive device into the taxi and had asked to be driven to Liverpool Women and Children's Hospital.
node.content:
["A taxi driver has been hailed a hero after helping avert a major terrorist incident in the English city of Liverpool on Sunday.", "The driver, named as David Perry, was injured when the cab he was driving exploded outside Liverpool Women's Hospital just before 11am on Remembrance Sunday.", "Police say the passenger in the car, who was killed in the blast, had brought an explosive device into the taxi and had asked to be driven to the hospital.", "CCTV from the hospital shows the station wagon approaching the hospital car park drop-off section at speed before the explosion occurs.", "The taxi driver is seen exiting the vehicle before it is engulfed in flames.", "Police said the driver was treated for injuries and has since been released from hospital.", "Counter Terrorism Policing North Assistant Chief Constable Ross Jackson said an army bomb disposal team had made the area safe.", "\"Our enquiries also indicate that the device was brought into the cab by the passenger.", "\"We believe we know the identity of the passenger but cannot confirm this at this time.\"", "On Sunday evening local time police arrested three men, aged 21, 26 and 29, at an address in Liverpool under the Terrorism Act, and a fourth man aged in his 20s at a separate address on Monday morning.", "Police said the men will be interviewed by counter-terrorism officers and several properties were still being searched.", "", "
Emergency services outside Liverpool Women's Hospital after Sunday's deadly explosion.(AP: PA/Peter Byrne)
", "Assistant chief constable Jackson said the explosion had been declared a terrorism incident but police were still not sure what the motivation for the attack was.", "\"Our enquiries indicate that an improvised explosive device has been manufactured and our assumption so far is that this was built by the passenger in the taxi,\" he said.", "\"We are of course aware that there were remembrance events just a short distance away from the hospital and that the ignition occurred shortly before 11am.", "\"We cannot at this time draw any connection with this but it is a line of inquiry we are pursuing.\"", "
'Heroic' taxi driver praised for actions
", "Liverpool mayor Joanne Anderson and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson both singled out Mr Perry for praise after the incident.", "Ms Anderson suggested he had prevented the attacker from getting inside the hospital by locking the doors of his taxi.", "\"The taxi driver in his heroic efforts has managed to divert what could have been an absolutely awful disaster,\" she told the BBC.", "\"Our thanks go to him.\"", "Mr Johnson said he could not comment on the exact details of the incident.", "\"It does look as though the taxi driver in question did behave with incredible presence of mind and bravery,\" he said.", "\"But I've got to say that this is something that is an ongoing investigation and it would be premature to say much more than that.\""]
